intro: Cyathocnemis, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Montiaceae. These plants are typically small herbs with succulent leaves and produce small, greenish or yellowish flowers. They are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapted to thrive in dry conditions. Cyathocnemis species are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and their ability to store water in their foliage. The genus is native to regions of southern Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.
